{{Wireless embedded system |brand=TP-LINK |model=TL-WA501G |revision=v2.22 |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=04/20/2007 |manuf_country=China |manuf= |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=access point |fcc_id=TE7WA50XG |ic_id= |pwr_v=9 |pwr_amp=0.6 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Atheros |cpu1_model=AR2315A |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1=2 |fla1_brand= |fla1_model= |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1=8 |ram1_brand= |ram1_model= |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types= |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Atheros |wi1_chip1_model=AR2315A |wi1_chip2_brand= |wi1_chip2_model= |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bg |wi1_ant_conn=RP-SMA |wi1_txchains= |wi1_rxchains= |wi1_sstreams= |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand=Realtek |eth_chip2_model=RTL8201CP |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=1 |wan_ports= |flags= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bg |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip=192.168.1.1 |default_user=admin |default_pass=admin |oui=54:E6:FC |oui_eth=54:E6:FC }} ''54Mbps Wireless Access Point''
[http://www.tp-link.com/us/products/details/?model=TL-WA501G Product page] "Model: wireless access point" and "REV: 1.2" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. [https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=17252 TL-WA501G on the OpenWrt forums] (w/ internal photos) :2MB Flash, 8MB RAM :"MODEL:Wireless Access Point A (AR)" and "REV: 1.3" is silkscreened on the board.
